phase1.title: Phase 1: Immediate Safety Training Assessment
phase1.description: Comprehensive assessment covering immediate safety procedures, equipment identification, and emergency response protocols.

questions.question: Take a photo of a fire extinguisher on your vessel and upload it below. The photo must clearly show the pressure gauge and instruction label.
questions.instructions:
Find any fire extinguisher on the vessel. Take a clear photo showing:
• The pressure gauge (green/red indicator)
• The instruction label with operating steps
• The type of extinguisher (foam, CO2, powder, etc.)
• The inspection tag with date

questions.question: Locate and photograph the emergency shutoff valves for the gasoil tanks. Upload a photo showing the valve position and labeling.
questions.instructions:
Find the emergency shutoff valves for gasoil tanks. Your photo must show:
• The valve handle/lever in current position
• Clear labeling indicating 'Emergency Shutoff' or similar
• The tank or system the valve controls
• Any operating instructions posted nearby

questions.question: Find and photograph the 'Schriftelijke Instructies' (Written Instructions) posted in a common area. The text must be clearly readable.
questions.instructions:
Locate the written instructions (Schriftelijke Instructies) posted on the vessel. Take a photo that shows:
• The complete document with all text readable
• The title 'Schriftelijke Instructies' or equivalent
• Emergency contact numbers if included
• Any safety procedures or protocols listed

questions.question: What is the correct sequence for using a fire extinguisher?
options: Pull pin, Aim at base, Squeeze handle, Sweep side to side
Aim at flames, Pull pin, Squeeze handle, Sweep up and down
Squeeze handle, Pull pin, Aim at base, Sweep side to side
Pull pin, Aim at flames, Squeeze handle, Stand still
questions.explanation: The PASS method: Pull the pin, Aim at the base of the fire, Squeeze the handle, Sweep from side to side.

questions.question: Should you enter the engine room immediately after a CO2 fire suppression system has been activated?
questions.explanation: Never enter an engine room immediately after CO2 discharge. CO2 displaces oxygen and creates a deadly atmosphere. Wait for proper ventilation and use breathing apparatus.

questions.question: The general alarm consists of _____ short blasts followed by _____ long blast(s).
questions.template: The general alarm consists of [BLANK] short blasts followed by [BLANK] long blast(s).
questions.explanation: The general alarm signal is seven short blasts followed by one long blast, indicating an emergency requiring immediate crew response.

questions.question: Arrange the following emergency response steps in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Correct order: 1) Assess situation, 2) Secure scene, 3) Sound alarm, 4) Take immediate action, 5) Report to captain, 6) Document incident

questions.question: Match each piece of safety equipment with its primary use:
questions.explanation: Lifebuoy for man overboard, Lifejacket for personal flotation, Eye wash for chemical exposure, Respiratory filter for toxic atmospheres.

questions.question: What is Burando Maritime Services' policy regarding alcohol and drugs on board?
questions.sampleAnswer: Zero tolerance policy - no alcohol or drugs permitted at any time while on vessel or on duty

questions.question: You witness a crew member slip and fall on deck but they get up and say they're fine. What should you do?
questions.scenario: During routine deck operations, you see a colleague slip on a wet surface and fall. They immediately get up, brush themselves off, and insist they are not injured and don't want to make a fuss. However, you notice they seem to be favoring one leg slightly.
options: Do nothing since they said they're fine
Report the incident to the captain immediately
Wait to see if symptoms develop later
Only report if the person asks you to
questions.explanation: All incidents, including near misses and minor injuries, must be reported immediately to the captain regardless of the person's initial assessment. This ensures proper documentation and medical evaluation.

questions.question: What does the company's 'Zero Spills, Zero Incidents' mission mean?
options: Complete prevention of all spills and incidents
Only major incidents should be prevented
Spills are acceptable if properly cleaned
questions.explanation: The company is committed to complete prevention of all spills and incidents, regardless of size.

questions.question: When is a work permit required?
options: For any work that poses potential risks
questions.explanation: Work permits are required for any work activity that poses potential safety or environmental risks.
